alert.note: Alert for Davidson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A slow moving thunderstorm producing heavy rain will impact portions of eastern Davidson County through 500 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Lexington. This storm was nearly stationary and has already produced 1 to 2 inches of rainfall. HAZARD...Heavy rain may produce localized flooding in poor drainage locations. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Linwood, Denton, Gordontown, High Rock Boat Dock Marina, Nc Wildlife Access Boat Launch, High Rock Lake Marina & Campground, High Rock Lake and High Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
